H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2971.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Segub<SDBH:שְׂגוּב>}, descendant of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► leader of conquest of a large area in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>} during the settlement of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H7027.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Abiel<SDBH:אֲבִיאֵל>}; tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► father of king {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H5019.def: = man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} from 605-562 B.C. who led the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>} into exile

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H894.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Mesopotamia<SDBH:שִׁנְעָר>}; ► founded by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>}; location of "tower of Babel"; capital of {L:Chaldean<SDBH:כַּשְׂדִּים>} empire

H1473.def: = causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

H3204.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Jehoiakim<SDBH:יְהֹויָקִים>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► king of Judah (597); taken captive to {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>} by {L:Nebuchadnezzar<SDBH:נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר>}

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H8337.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H1896.def: = man, also known as {L:Hege<SDBH:הֵגֶא>}; ► {L:eunuch<SDBH:סָרִיס>} in charge of women of {L:Ahasuerus<SDBH:אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ>}

H5631.def: = a male who has been castrated and made to serve in the women's quarters in the royal palace

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H635.def: = woman whose Hebrew name was {L:Hadassah<SDBH:הֲדַסָּה>}; ◄ cousin of {L:Mordecai<SDBH:מָרְדֳּכַי>}; ► married {L:Xerxes<SDBH:אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ>} and so became queen Esther of {L:Persia<SDBH:פָּרַס>} and helped save the Jews from extermination

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H2887.def: = tenth month of the Hebrew calendar, roughly corresponding to the period of  mid-December to mid-January; ◄ this Babylonian name was used by the Jews from the time of the exile

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4438.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H3804.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by a queen as a symbol of authority and status

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H2060.def: = woman; ► wife of {L:Ahasuerus<SDBH:אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ>}, king of {L:Persia<SDBH:פָּרַס>}; was deposed as queen of Persia and replaced by {L:Esther<SDBH:אֶסְתֵּר>}

H2010.def: exact meaning uncertain; possibly: = a reduction of taxes, proclaimed at a special occasions

H4082.def: = an adminstrative division of a country or a city

H4864.def: literally: lifting up; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well-being of others
